task: How to Make Corned Beef Hash
step: Gather the ingredients.
Combine corned roast beef hash, onion , mayonnaise, salt and pepper in a bowl.
Lightly toast bread.
Spread the corned beef hash mixture on bread.
Defrost.
Prep bread.
Prep sauce.
Cook the meat.
Finish the meat.
Finish the bread.
Finish the meal.
Enjoy your burger bites!.

task: How to Grill That Perfect Burger
step: Start with fresh ground chuck.
Make sure the chuck has a fat content of at least 15 to 22 percent to ensure juiciness.
Chill the beef well before forming patties.
Season the meat with salt and pepper.
Make each patty by forming about half a pound of ground chuck into a tight ball about the size of a baseball.
Use a spatula or other straight-edged tool to "pull in" the sides of the patty so that they remain together and tight.
Form patties about 1/2- to 3/4-inch thick.
Build a hot fire in the grill.
Place the burgers on the grill over direct heat.
Check doneness by peeking inside a patty with a spatula, or use an instant-read food thermometer inserted into the center of the patty.
Serve on fresh buns with any toppings you prefer: cheese, tomatoes, lettuce, onion, pickles and condiments such as ketchup, mayonnaise or mustard.
Finished.

task: How to Grill a Burger on a Foreman Grill
step: Choose frozen burger patties that are no more than 0.5 in (1.3 cm) thick.
Preheat the grill for 5 minutes.
Place 2-4 frozen patties on the lower grill plate.
Close the lid and cook the burgers for 4.5-6.5 minutes.
Remove the burgers and test the internal temperature for doneness.
Eat the burgers before the internal temperature falls below 140 °F (60 °C).
Gather the ingredients.
Make the basic polenta recipe from Method 1.
Stir in the butter and cheese.
Stir in the milk, parsley and spices.
Place the polenta in a bowl and serve hot.
